org.factcenter.qilin.util

Class BitMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.factcenter.qilin.util.BitMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, Sendable

    public final class BitMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sendable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Represents a matrix of bits with corresponding operations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BitMatrix()
      Don't ever call this explicitly: used only for deserialization!
      BitMatrix(byte[] bits, int offs)
      Create a vector by wrapping a byte array.
      BitMatrix(byte[] bits, int rowOffs, int numCols, int numRows)
      Create a matrix by wrapping a byte array.
      BitMatrix(byte[] bits, int rowOffs, int numCols, int numRows, int bytesPerRow)
      Create a new bitmatrix sharing a backing array with an existing one, and using copy-on-write semantics.
      BitMatrix(byte[] bits, int rowOffs, int numCols, int numRows, int bytesPerRow, boolean copyOnWrite, boolean zeroPadding)
      Create a matrix by wrapping a byte array.
      BitMatrix(int numCols)
      Utility constructor for bit vector.
      BitMatrix(int numCols, int numRows)
      Create a new BitMatrix with numRows rows and numCols columns.

        Don't ever call this explicitly: used only for deserialization!

      • BitMatrix

        public BitMatrix(int numCols,
                 int numRows)
        Create a new BitMatrix with numRows rows and numCols columns. To create a bit vector, set numRows to 1.
        Parameters:
        numCols -
        numRows -

      • BitMatrix

        public BitMatrix(int numCols)
        Utility constructor for bit vector.

      • BitMatrix

        public BitMatrix(byte[] bits,
                 int offs)
        Create a vector by wrapping a byte array. Note that the backing array is not copied---changes to this array will be reflected in the vector, but copy-on-write semantics are used for BitMatrix operations..

      • BitMatrix

        public BitMatrix(byte[] bits,
                 int rowOffs,
                 int numCols,
                 int numRows)
        Create a matrix by wrapping a byte array. Note that the backing array is not copied---changes to this array will be reflected in the matrix.
        Parameters:
        bits -
        numCols -
        numRows -

      • BitMatrix

        public BitMatrix(byte[] bits,
                 int rowOffs,
                 int numCols,
                 int numRows,
                 int bytesPerRow,
                 boolean copyOnWrite,
                 boolean zeroPadding)
        Create a matrix by wrapping a byte array. Note that the backing array is not copied---changes to this array will be reflected in the matrix unless the provided array is too small (in that case a new array will be allocated).
        Parameters:
        bits -
        numCols -
        numRows -

      • BitMatrix

        public BitMatrix(byte[] bits,
                 int rowOffs,
                 int numCols,
                 int numRows,
                 int bytesPerRow)
        Create a new bitmatrix sharing a backing array with an existing one, and using copy-on-write semantics.
        Parameters:

        rowOffs -
        numCols -
        numRows -

        How many bytes are used for a row with a specified number of columns.

      • getUsedBytesPerRow

        public final int getUsedBytesPerRow()
        Return the number of bytes actually used in row.

      • valueOf

        public static BitMatrix valueOf(long value,
                                int width)
        Return a new BitMatrix representing an (unsigned) integer value. The matrix contains a single row of width columnts, with bits stored in LSB-first order.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to represent
        width - the width in bits.

      • valueOf

        public static BitMatrix valueOf(java.math.BigInteger value,
                                int width)

        Parameters:

      • toInteger

        public final long toInteger()

      • toInteger

        public final long toInteger(int width)
        Convert the least-significant width bits of the first row in this matrix to an integer (well-defined only for width up to 64).
        Parameters:
        width -

      • toBigInteger

        public final java.math.BigInteger toBigInteger()
        Convert the entire vector (first row) into a BigInteger. The value is always treated as unsigned in little-endian order (LSB first).

      • toBigInteger

        public final java.math.BigInteger toBigInteger(int width)
        Convert the least-significant width bits of the first row in this matrix to a BigInteger. The value is always treated as unsigned in little-endian order (LSB first).
        Parameters:
        width -

      • clonePacked

        public final void clonePacked(byte[] dst,
                              int colStart,
                              int numCols)
        Clone the current BitMatrix into a byte array in packed form, starting from a given column. The destination array must have enough space to contain the data.
        Parameters:
        dst -
        colStart -
        numCols -

      • subcolumns

        public void subcolumns(int colStart,
                       int newNumCols)
        Reduce the number of columns in a row without allocating a new backing array. Note:The backing array after this operation may not be zero-padded, Moreover, operations that do zero-pad xorRow(int, BitMatrix, int) and fillRandom(Random)) may change values outside the columns spanned by the submatrix.
        Parameters:
        newNumCols -

      • subrows

        public void subrows(int rowStart,
                    int newNumRows)
        Reduce the number of rows without allocating a new backing array.
        Parameters:
        rowStart -
        newNumRows -

      • internalCopy

        public final void internalCopy()
        Ensure that the backing array is not shared with another BitMatrix

      • clone

        public final BitMatrix clone()
        Create a clone of this BitMatrix (backing array is copied). The new clone will be in packed format.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • getSubMatrix

        public BitMatrix getSubMatrix(int startRow,
                              int numRows)
        Return a sub-matrix with the same number of columns but a subset of the rows. The backing array is shared between the matrices (direct changes in one will appear in the other), but uses copy-on-write semantics (BitMatrix operations that modify the backing array will trigger a full copy).
        Parameters:
        startRow - Starting row (inclusive)
        numRows - number of rows.

      • getSubMatrixCols

        public BitMatrix getSubMatrixCols(int startCol,
                                  int newNumCols)
        Return a sub-matrix with the same number of rows but a subset of the columns. The backing array may be shared between the matrices (changes in one will appear in the other), or may be copied (if the start column isn't on a byte boundary).
        Parameters:
        startCol - Starting column (inclusive)
        newNumCols - number of columns in new matrix

      • isZeroPadded

        public boolean isZeroPadded()

      • zeroPad

        public void zeroPad()
        Zero all the padding bits (if any).

      • fillRandom

        public void fillRandom(java.util.Random rand)
        Fill the matrix with random bits. Note: currently fills the entire backing array -- so will affect "parents" of submatrices.
        Parameters:
        rand -

      • getBackingArray

        public final byte[] getBackingArray()
        Return the backing array.

      • getPackedBits

        public final byte[] getPackedBits(boolean forceCopy)
        Return the array in packed format. The size of the array is guaranteed to be getNumRows()*ceil(getNumCols()/8): (Each row is byte-aligned). If the backing array is already in packed format and zero-padded, this method will not copy the array (otherwise a new array will be allocated and the bits copied)

      • getNumRows

        public final int getNumRows()

      • getNumCols

        public final int getNumCols()

      • getRowIndex

        public final int getRowIndex(int row)
        Return the byte index in the backing array for the beginning of a row.
        Parameters:
        row -

      • getRowLen

        public final int getRowLen()
        Return number of bytes in a row. Note that if the number of columns is not divisible by 8, the last byte of the row will be padded with zero bits.

      • getRow

        public final java.nio.ByteBuffer getRow(int row)
        Return a row as a ByteBuffer (by wrapping the backing array).
        Parameters:
        row - the row index.

      • getBit

        public final int getBit(int col,
                        int row)
        Return the bit at position (col, row) in the matrix.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index (zero based)
        col - the column index (zero based)
        Returns:
        the bit (0 or 1)

      • getBits

        public final long getBits(int col,
                          int row,
                          int bitLen)
        Return a word constructed from biLen bits beginning at position (col, row) in the matrix. The word is assumed to be packed LSB first
        Parameters:
        row - the row index (zero based)
        col - the column index (zero based)
        bitLen - length of the word (up to 64 bits)
        Returns:
        the word

      • setBits

        public final void setBits(int col,
                          int row,
                          int bitLen,
                          long word)
        Write a word into the packed bit array. Word is written LSB first. If the word overflows the columns it is truncated.
        Parameters:
        col - Starting column
        row - Starting row
        bitLen - length of word in bits
        word - word to write.

      • setBits

        public final void setBits(int col,
                          BitMatrix newBits)
        Copy all the bits (in row 0) from newBits into this BitMatrix, starting at column col (row 0)
        Parameters:
        col -
        newBits -

      • setBits

        public final void setBits(int col,
                          int maxLen,
                          BitMatrix newBits)
        Copy up to maxLen bits from newBits to this BitMatrix, starting at column col (row 0)

      • xorRow

        public final void xorRow(int dstRow,
                         BitMatrix src,
                         int srcRow)
        XOR a row of another matrix with a row of this matrix
        Parameters:
        dstRow - the row in this matrix
        src - the other matrix whose row we XORing to this
        srcRow - the row in src to xor.

      • copyRow

        public final void copyRow(int dstStart,
                          BitMatrix src,
                          int srcStart,
                          int srcLen)
        Overwrite part of this bitvector with part of another. If the source overflows the destination only a prefix will be copied.* @param dstRow the row in this matrix
        Parameters:
        dstStart - the first column that will be overwritten
        src - the other matrix whose row we are copying
        srcStart - the first column to read from
        srcLen - the number of bits to copy.

      • copyRow

        public final void copyRow(int dstRow,
                          int dstStart,
                          BitMatrix src,
                          int srcRow,
                          int srcStart,
                          int srcLen)
        Copy part of a row from another matrix to part of a row in this matrix. If the source row overflows the destination row only a prefix will be copied.
        Parameters:
        dstRow - the row in this matrix
        dstStart - the first column that will be overwritten
        src - the other matrix whose row we are copying
        srcRow - the row in src to copy.
        srcStart - the first column to read from
        srcLen - the number of bits to copy.

      • copyRow

        public final void copyRow(int dstRow,
                          BitMatrix src,
                          int srcRow)
        Copy a row from another matrix to a row of this matrix. If the row is longer only a prefix will be copied. Note: this operation will zeropad the backing array.
        Parameters:
        dstRow - the row in this matrix
        src - the other matrix whose row we are copying
        srcRow - the row in src to copy.

      • copyBits

        public final void copyBits(BitMatrix src)
        Copy the bits from another wrapped bit-vector matrix into this matrix. Notes: this operation will zero-pad the backing array. if src vector is longer, only the prefix will be copied.
        Parameters:
        src - the matrix containing the bits to copy.

      • reset

        public final void reset()
        Sets the elements of the bits byte array to zero.

      • xor

        public final void xor(BitMatrix b)
        Xor an entire matrix. The matrix must have at least the same number of rows and columns.
        Parameters:
        b -

      • transpose

        public final BitMatrix transpose()
        Transpose the matrix
        Returns:
        the transpose.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Test equality. Two bitmatrices are considered equal if their bits are equal (regardless of the contents of the backing array outside the "real" data. This is an inefficient test at the moment that works bit-by-bit.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other -
